intro: Peucedanum millefolium, commonly known as sweet cicely, is a herbaceous plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its finely divided, feather-like leaves that give it a lacy appearance. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. Its aromatic seeds are often used in culinary and medicinal applications. Peucedanum millefolium thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is native to parts of Europe and Asia.
